sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A brief account of the proceedings against the six popish priests, condemned for high-treason on the 17th day of this instant January, 1679/80 viz. Lionel Anderson, alias Munson, William Russell, George Parry, Henry Starkey, James Corker, and Will. Marshal, two Benedictine monks, formerly tryed with Wakeman : with whom was likewise tryed Alexander Lumsdell : who though he appeared to be a priest, yet being born in Scotland, he continues upon a special verdict : the heads of the evidence against each of them, and their defences and behaviour. Anderson, Lionel, d. 1710, defendant. Corker, James Maurus, 1636-1715, defendant. Kemish, David Joseph, defendant. Lumsden, Alexander, defendant. Parris, Charles, defendant. Russel, William, defendant. Starkey, Henry, defendant.
4 p.
s.n., [London? : 1680]
Caption title. Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
=======
A brief account of the proceedings against the six popish priests, condemned for high-treason on the 17th day of this instant January, 1679/80 viz. Lionel Anderson, alias Munson, William Russell, George Parry, Henry Starkey, James Corker, and Will. Marshal, two Benedictine monks, formerly tryed with Wakeman : with whom was likewise tryed Alexander Lumsdell : who though he appeared to be a priest, yet being born in Scotland, he continues upon a special verdict : the heads of the evidence against each of them, and their defences and behaviour. Anderson, Lionel, d. 1710, defendant. Corker, James Maurus, 1636-1715, defendant. Kemish, David Joseph, defendant. Lumsden, Alexander, defendant. Parris, Charles, defendant. Russel, William, defendant. Starkey, Henry, defendant.
